original_solution_mapping.L1: Benny will spend 3 * 10 = $<<3*10=30>>30 to make the pumpkin pies.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He will spend 5 * 12 = $<<5*12=60>>60 to make the cherry pies.
original_solution_mapping.L3: He wants to make a profit of $20, so he has to earn 30 + 60 + 20 = $<<30+60+20=110>>110 selling all the pies.
original_solution_mapping.L4: He is making 22 pies, so he needs to charge 110 / 22 = $<<110/22=5>>5 per pie.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3261.
    Returns: the price Benny has to charge for each pie.
    """
    # L1
    cost_per_pumpkin_pie = 3 # cost $3 each to make
    num_pumpkin_pies = 10 # ten pumpkin pies
    total_cost_pumpkin_pies = cost_per_pumpkin_pie * num_pumpkin_pies

    # L2
    cost_per_cherry_pie = 5 # cost $5 each to make
    num_cherry_pies = 12 # twelve cherry pies
    total_cost_cherry_pies = cost_per_cherry_pie * num_cherry_pies

    # L3
    desired_profit = 20 # profit of $20
    total_earnings_needed = total_cost_pumpkin_pies + total_cost_cherry_pies + desired_profit

    # L4
    total_pies_made = num_pumpkin_pies + num_cherry_pies
    price_per_pie = total_earnings_needed / total_pies_made

    # FA
    answer = price_per_pie
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Benny will spend {cost_per_pumpkin_pie} * {num_pumpkin_pies} = $<<{cost_per_pumpkin_pie}*{num_pumpkin_pies}={total_cost_pumpkin_pies}>>{total_cost_pumpkin_pies} to make the pumpkin pies.
He will spend {cost_per_cherry_pie} * {num_cherry_pies} = $<<{cost_per_cherry_pie}*{num_cherry_pies}={total_cost_cherry_pies}>>{total_cost_cherry_pies} to make the cherry pies.

He wants to make a profit of ${desired_profit}, so he has to earn {total_cost_pumpkin_pies} + {total_cost_cherry_pies} + {desired_profit} = $<<{total_cost_pumpkin_pies}+{total_cost_cherry_pies}+{desired_profit}={total_earnings_needed}>>{total_earnings_needed} selling all the pies.
He is making {total_pies_made} pies, so he needs to charge {total_earnings_needed} / {total_pies_made} = $<<{total_earnings_needed}/{total_pies_made}={price_per_pie}>>{price_per_pie} per pie.

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'total_cost_cherry_pies' (value: 60) was reported instead of 'price_per_pie' (value: 5.0).
